intro: Melochia tomentella, commonly known as the woolly melochia, is a tropical shrub native to parts of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green foliage and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces oval, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
